pullRequest.title: SAMZA-2452 : Adding internal autosizing related configs
pullRequest.bodyText:
Adding internal autosizing related configs, can be used by an external controller.
These sizing-related configs (e.g., container-count, etc) take precedence when job.autosizing.enabled is set, otherwise existing behavior is retained.
Symptom: Sizing configs set by a controller need to be different from user-facing configs.
Cause: --
Fix: Added internal configs for sizing related configs. Added tests.
The enabled config is also needs to be emitted by the DiagnosticsManager.
API Changes: Adding internal autosizing related configs (job.autosizing.enabled, job.autosizing.container.count, job.autosizing.container.thread.pool.size, job.autosizing.maxheap.mb, job.autosizing.cpu.cores) , can be used by an external controller. These sizing-related configs (e.g., container-count, etc) take precedence when job.autosizing.enabled is set, otherwise existing behavior is retained.

commit.message: Adding missing read for autosizing enabled

nodes.bodyText: Should this use getAutosizingEnabled instead of checking the config directly? Then if getAutosizingEnabled gets changed in the future, this would not change.
Could you please use autosizing instead of autoscaling to keep terminology consistent?
Same about autosizing instead of autoscaling.

If someone adds a new autosizing config, then it might not be obvious to remember to update this method, especially since it is a couple hundred lines away from the config key declaration.
Here are a couple suggestions that might help:

Create a new enum class in which each autosizing config is a value in the enum. Then, you could use Enum.values() to create a set of autosizing configs. This is nice, because someone only needs to add the enum value, and then the code automatically picks it up.
Create a static Set of autosizing keys, and then declare that set as a static variable right next to where you declare the autosizing constants. There is still a chance of forgetting to update the set, but it's at least close in proximity to the declarations.
Change the implementation of this method to check that the config key matches a prefix (e.g. job.autosizing). It's "convention"-y, but then no one will need to update this implementation as long as they follow the prefix pattern.
Is there a case where you want to intentionally delete an autosizing config? For example, for cleaning up after getting a stable set of parameters.
Could you please add a unit test for this?
I think this section is the same as the block above. Seems like the code doesn't match the comment.

nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -130,6 +130,15 @@
   public static final String CONTAINER_METADATA_FILENAME_FORMAT = "%s.metadata"; // Filename: <containerID>.metadata
   public static final String CONTAINER_METADATA_DIRECTORY_SYS_PROPERTY = "samza.log.dir";
 
+  // Auto-sizing related configs tthat ake precedence over respective sizing confings job.container.count, etc,

nodes.bodyText: I don't think this should be removed. It is actually a different test case (i.e. autosizing is disabled).

commit.message: Adding tests for TestJobConfig, fixing typo
